ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more about how to discuss life decisions, financials, and a lot about ASL poetry and storytelling (rhyme, rhythm, traditional vs modern poetry, etc.)
Both conversational and formal ASL skills, storytelling, more advanced use of classifiers

Growing from ASL 1, 2, and 3 -- In this course, we learned some more practical ASL signs (discussing life decisions, money, etc) and also some cultural aspects of ASL like Deaf theater. Improving comprehension and conversational ASL

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths - ASL at Yale is absolutely amazing and I would recommend it to anyone! One of the biggest strengths is that every student is required to do a service project and engage with the Deaf community which is incredible valuable. ASL classes are also typically very tight-knit which provides for a great classroom environment every day. Weaknesses - Sometimes the service projects are a big hectic to organize.

strengths: passionate, engaging professors, opportunities to engage in the community, conversational and formal practice
weaknesses: none

This was a great course! I found it more organized than ASL 3, which was great and helped my learning a lot. The course was engaging and constant because it meets every day, but I never found it super overwhelming. I think one of the things I might have liked would have been more guidance on expectations for formal presentations. I felt like I learned the most in the more conversational aspects of the course.
This course is just so fun, minor weaknesses regarding course organization and clarity of assignments, but overall so strong!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Whether you need it for your language requirement or not, I would 100% recommend taking ASL.
Yes!! ASL is an incredible language, and taking classes in this department really integrates you into a wonderful community.
I would absolutely recommend this course - I feel a lot more confident in my ASL skills and my knowledge about the Deaf community after having taken it

Yes! I love the ASL department at Yale and had a great time in the course. I think it will only improve in the future as the program continues to grow and has more longevity. Certainly would recommend!
YES YES YES! Take ASL! Its not just a class but actually a community and I think everyone should have the chance to take it.
